image.altText: The Australian Aboriginal flag at the top of South Australia's parliament.

props.synopsis: It's been two years since South Australia's Parliament passed historic legislation establishing a First Nations Voice. How is it working?

title.children: Has Australia’s first Voice to Parliament been a success?

image.altText: looking down a town street with buildings from the left side of the road

props.synopsis: South Australian councils say they need more federal funding allocated as communities call for improved services ahead of the federal election.

title.children: Regional councils demand more federal cash as they pick up services

image.altText: A woman in a blue jacket speaking in a corridor with a light above her head

props.synopsis: The Greens say they will push to increase the environment’s share of funding in the federal budget to one per cent if they hold the balance of power after the election.

title.children: Greens reveal environment spending plan for minority government

image.altText: Flames and smoke coming from a low scrubby area

props.synopsis: The South Australian Country Fire Service (CFS) says the threat from a bushfire burning near Robe, in the state's south-east, has reduced.

title.children: Reduced threat from bushfire burning near Robe in south-east SA

image.altText: Black and yellow packets of cigarettes in a white drawer full of packs.

props.synopsis: A decline in cigarette sales amid a boom in illegal tobacco has added to the stress for small businesses already struggling.

title.children: Cigarette retailers struggle as smokers turn to black market

image.altText: an image of a car's driver side mirror with a truck reflected, driving through a town

props.synopsis: A freight bypass estimated to divert up to 420,000 trucks a year from congested Adelaide thoroughfares is back on the agenda following the federal budget.

title.children: Long-awaited SA freight route back on table ahead of federal election

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles at a medical staff at a press conference inside a hospital

props.synopsis: Both federal Labor and the Coalition have pledged to contribute $150 million towards a new $300 million healthcare centre planned at Flinders University.

title.children: Bipartisan support to invest $150m for health training hub in SA

image.altText: Dead fish by a boot, for size reference. The boot is a quarter of the fish's length.

props.synopsis: Residents say they have seen fish and other marine life washed ashore in the days since a large-scale toxic algae bloom and fish kill at Fleurieu Peninsula beaches.

title.children: Kangaroo Islanders report 'hundreds' of dead fish on beaches

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446962

props.synopsis: The sea shanty Bound for South Australia has become an anthem that celebrates the distinctiveness of a state not necessarily renowned for distinction, especially on the sporting field. But the song captures the sentiment of the state's remarkable Sheffield Shield win, writes Daniel Keane.

title.children: The Sheffield Shield was Bound for South Australia, now it has arrived

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier is dressed in a multi-coloured jacket as she addresses the media

props.synopsis: More than 2,300 cases of the flu have been recorded in SA so far this year — 690 more than the same time last year — and the government is urging parents with young children to get their free vaccination.

title.children: Parents urged to get children vaccinated as flu cases rise in SA

image.altText: Aerial view of Tarrkarri -  a vast beige mushroom with landscaped gardens in the centre of the CBD

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas has announced more funding for the arts, but none to help build a long-delayed First Nations cultural centre in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Dream for SA First Nations cultural centre 'still alive', Premier says

image.altText: A blue lake, with a green cliff and a rural city stretching on behind the cliff.

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 people are expected to move to SA's Limestone Coast in the next 25 years, but local leaders say a mountain of work needs to be done.

title.children: Mount Gambier is tipped to boom, but leaders say infrastructure is lacking

image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: At this time last year, David Speirs was adamant his position as SA Liberal leader was "100 per cent secure". But the past 12 months have brought almost nothing other than challenges for the now 40-year-old, who last week stood in the dock.

title.children: David Speirs has gone from '100 per cent secure' to a guilty plea

image.altText: anthony albanese

props.synopsis: Labor wants to enlist the consumer watchdog to stamp out a problem the commission says isn’t happening, while the Coalition wants to give the consumer watchdog break-up powers the commission hasn’t asked for.

title.children: Both major parties are shopping empty promises on supermarkets

image.altText: Peter Dutton Nick Riewoldt

props.synopsis: The Liberal leader has offered few details about his plan to fight what he says is indoctrination in schools, seized on by Labor as copying Donald Trump.

title.children: Dutton could exert funding influence over schools, but curriculum a can of worms

image.altText: woman with white blonde hair and wearing a navy suit looks down the camera

props.synopsis: In a statement, her family says Ms Giuffre's vehicle was hit by a school bus in rural Western Australia, but she returned home before going to hospital.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre remains in 'serious condition' after bus crash, family says

image.altText: Donald Trump stands and speaks at a podium in front of a portrait of Ronald Reagan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's preoccupation with tariffs isn't new. But economists say US history shows trade barriers end up costing consumers and businesses more.

title.children: History of American tariffs offers stark insights into Trump's plans

image.altText: An older woman with grey hair and a pink shirt stares into the camera, while sitting on an outdoor lounge.

props.synopsis: Western Sydney, which is a region made up of 14 seats, is considered as integral to the major parties for the upcoming federal election.

title.children: Helen has voted Labor for 40 years. There are a few reasons she won't this time

image.altText: Steph Hodgins-May speaks in the senate

props.synopsis: At some point, the major political parties will have to confront the failures in Australia’s early childhood education and care system head on.

title.children: The perfect election issue is being overlooked by most politicians

image.altText: A ute and two people walking in street filled with floodwater.

props.synopsis: Queenslanders displaced by catastrophic flooding are sitting tight as they wait to return to their homes, but it is already clear that the road to recovery will be long and difficult.

title.children: Outback 'boneyards' emerging, more rain to come for flooded Queenslanders

image.altText: Five gas cylinders next to each other with multiple pipes connected together.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is under pressure to publish modelling and details of his gas plan, which has faced a barrage of industry condemnation.

title.children: Taxpayers could be on hook if foreign companies sue over Dutton gas plan

image.altText: A close-up of Luigi Mangione.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's attorney-general orders prosecutors to seek the death penalty for Luigi Mangione, the man accused of murdering a health insurance boss on a New York street last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione an early target of Trump orders on death penalty

image.altText: Min Aung Hlaing wears a military dress uniform with medals on his chest and around his neck.

props.synopsis: Multiple Western aid agencies said they have struggled to get personnel into Myanmar as the ruling junta leads the response to the country's largest natural disaster in years.

title.children: In Myanmar's darkest hour, this dictator cloaks the country in secrecy

image.altText: Golden cliffs above a blue-green sea on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Local communities say they need help managing overtourism as mass visitation creates issues for wildlife, raises evacuation concerns, and poses safety risks.

title.children: Communities grapple with overtourism as social media fuels popularity

props.synopsis: A project in regional NSW has shown the number of students at risk of homelessness can be halved with a "deceptively simple" intervention.

title.children: Can we end youth homelessness before it begins? One city shows it can be done

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian stocks are likely to post modest gains at open after Wall Street benchmarks ended in mixed fashion, as investors were caught in limbo ahead of the impending tariff announcements from the Trump administration. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Gold soars as markets eye Trump tariffs, ASX to rise

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Foreign companies could sue over Dutton gas plan
Kalgoorlie celebrates as gold hits record price
How local market reacted to RBA rates decision

image.altText: Palestinian children wait to receive food cooked by a charity kitchen

props.synopsis: Israel says more than 400,000 tonnes of aid entered Gaza during the ceasefire and there is plenty of food, but a UN spokesperson says, "as far as the UN is concerned, that's ridiculous … we are at the tail end of our supplies".

title.children: Israel says plenty of food in Gaza, UN says that's 'ridiculous'

image.altText: a spinach crop

props.synopsis: Nearly 50 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by major supermarkets after E. coli was found during routine testing.

title.children: Source of salad contamination sought after major supermarket recall

image.altText: an obviously fake prosthetic eye

props.synopsis: Losing an eye is a traumatic experience, having an artificial eye made should help with the healing process. For these people, who were clients of Jack McDonald, it wasn't.

title.children: Complaints about 'unacceptable' eye maker in unregulated industry

image.altText: An illustration of a husband and wife pulling apart their own half of the family home

props.synopsis: A new report has revealed that Australia's divorce rates have fallen to their lowest levels in almost fifty years. But the reason why is not as simple as it seems.

title.children: 'Women who aren't able to leave': Understanding Australia's low divorce rate

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A High Court hearing for a challenge between PepsiCo and the Australian Tax Office today will be an important test of Australia's laws set up to tax overseas companies appearing to derive profits here.

title.children: PepsiCo faces Australian Tax Office in High Court

image.altText: A design of the new civic centre building.

props.synopsis: The Darwin city council will soon begin building a $150 million CBD high-rise to replace its aging civic centre, in partnership with property developer DCOH.

title.children: $150m high-rise to replace Darwin city council headquarters

image.altText: Rick Nugent, dressed in a police uniform, stands a lectern indoors.

props.synopsis: Rick Nugent confirms he will not apply for the ongoing position but says he is still Victoria's acting chief commissioner amid media reports.

title.children: Breaking: Victoria's top cop Rick Nugent confirms he won't apply for ongoing job

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks off to the left side.

props.synopsis: With the row over whether Tasmania can afford a new stadium a long way from ending, Labor may think it can be a spectator to the melee. But, if Labor votes for the project and it goes badly, it'll be tied to the failure as well.

title.children: If Labor hitches its wagon to a stadium project flop, it'll be tied to the failure as well

image.altText: A young woman with a tattooed arm and a full-face helmet flashes a "V" sign in a car with a rollcage.

props.synopsis: A horror motorcycle accident left Christina Vithoulkas with complete loss of feeling and movement below her T5 vertebrae. She is now the world's first female para drifter.

title.children: How Christina went from a horror accident to the becoming the first female para drifter
